Articles.Content: Now, some people i see on the forums submit some challenges with objectives to go outside Kerbin's SOI or somewhere else.But, how about we stay right here and appreciate the values of the "Green Marble", if you know what i mean ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif). So, let's start our beautiful tour, with a challenge! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) **TRIP TO MOUNT KEVEREST** Ok, now the challenge is pretty simple, **get to the highest point on Kerbin**.Now, most of you are probably saying "Pfft, this is too easy.Why is this even a challenge?" Well, i'm not finished.You have to get there in style. **NOTE:** This challenge is intended for fun rather than fame.A big thanks to sal\_vager and his Itty Bitty Aeroplanes! challenge for inspiring me! So, people who enter will be divided into 3 categories based on the requirements: **Easy, Medium and Hard.** **RULES:** 1. No cheats (HyperEdit, Debug Menu) 2. Keep it mostly stock, but some mods are allowed(listed below). 3. You can only accomplish this challenge by an **aerial or terrestrial vehicle**. 4. You must build your craft only in the **Spaceplane Hangar**. 5. **No VAB rocket engines**.However, since this challenge is accomplishable by any kind of **aerial** **** or terrestrial vehicle, **R.A.P.I.E.R-s are acceptable.** 6. Your entry must contain at least 2 images or a video or an imgur album. **PERMITTED MODS:** - KER - Trajectories - FMRS - Kerbal Alarm Clock - HotRockets! or CoolRockets! - Chatterer Where is the highest point on Kerbin? It is located northeast of the KSC near the north pole.You will find a range of mountains, and there you will find the peak.It's height depends on the terrain setting you're using (usually ranges from 6761m to 6767m). Here's a picture of where it's located: ![2yuft3s.png](http://i59.tinypic.com/2yuft3s.png) An expanded view, just for orientation.You may use this map in case you get lost ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif): ![2rmxe28.png](http://i61.tinypic.com/2rmxe28.png) And last thing, how do i know in which category i will end? **EASY:** - Must contain at least 1 kerbal - Go to Keverest - Plant a flag (and optionally collect a surface sample or do an EVA report if you're in Career). - Go home **safely**. **MEDIUM:** - Must contain at least 5 kerbals - Go to Keverest - Get all 5 kerbals to the peak, plant a flag and return home **safely**. **HARD:** - Must contain at least 10 kerbals - Get into an orbit (at least 70 km) - Land near Keverest - Get all 10 kerbals to the peak, plant a flag, and return home safely... To add to the challenge experience, I added a point system! Here is how you score them: **+50** - Starting points! **+1** - For every Kerbal on your craft **-1** - For every Kerbal less on your craft **+5** - For every 10km above the 70km minimum in orbit. **+5** - Flag planted on peak **-5** - No flag planted on peak **-10** - Absolutely no Kerbals on your craft (drones, probes...) **+20** - If you got into orbit on Easy or Medium **-20** - If you didn't get into orbit on Hard **Amount of points \* 2** - If you get your craft home in perfect shape (no parts destroyed) **Half of your points terminated** - The craft was partially destroyed, but all or some Kerbals survived. **3/4 of your points terminated** - The craft was completely destroyed, but all or some Kerbals survived. **All of your points terminated** - Total mission failure (nobody survided, the entire thing was destroyed) **Enjoy!** **** ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) OLD BOARDS: Spoiler \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ **I Like it Easy... Board**: **- kelvindeschutter** **- Admiral-Helwyr** (Largest Craft) **- r\_rolo1** **- Batz\_10K** **- Torquimedes** **I Like it in Style! Board:** **- Bob\_Saget54** **- Kuzzter** **- Jean Deaux** **- ShadowZone** **- Foxster** **- hoioh** **- MunGazer** **- Squiggsy** (Smallest Craft) - sort of cheated, but didn't change how the game works whatsoever \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ **BOARDS:** **Easy:** **-** **-** **-** **-** - \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ **Medium:** **-** **-** **-** **-** - \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ **Hard:** **-** **-** **-** **-** - \_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_ **The official badge (created by Jean Deaux):** ![102wc9f.png](http://i62.tinypic.com/102wc9f.png) You can add this badge to your signatures.But if you dont know how to, here's how: 1. Go to Account Settings 2. Click Signature 3. Save this pic above to your PC. 4. Upload it to [tinypic.com](http://www.tinypic.com) 5. Copy the code under "IMG Code for Forums and Message Boards" and paste it into the signature editor.Add a link to the badge that leads to this page if you want. 6. Have fun! **Edited February 28, 2016 by Candlelight** refurbishment

I already mused about doing this by rovering to it from KSC while in my ( on hold ) attempt to rover to the South Pole ( the shortest route makes you pass right on the mountain feet ). Might try it , but it will take some days ( RL ones ) just to get there ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

You beat me to the punch! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) I was planning on developing a challenge like this with the goal of setting up a "telescope" on the peak. 

Nice challenge.. I'll put something together. ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

Interesting challenge. Quite a bit of trudging as each peak looked higher than the next, so I actually did a lot of back and forth trudging trying to find your exact waypoint. I suspect the mod you were using was yielding a slightly different number than the stock positioning system. I gave up walking peak to peak (would have driven, but the steeps were too... well, steep and my vehicle lacked the horsepower to traverse those slopes.

Flew the plane, landed on the mountain, dropped off a manned vehicle, drove it a short bit, trudged a LOT, got the soil sample, planted the flag, trudged some more, flew home, had a drink and called it a day.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Liab1w3-H_0?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Looking forward to that badge.

>

I gave up walking peak to peak (would have driven, but the steeps were too... well, steep and my vehicle lacked the horsepower to traverse those slopes.

Wow! This might be the best entry! Congratulations!

And also, i will see if i can get Ziv for the badge.

And btw, i wasn't using a mod for positioning ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif).

I was using this great site called KerbalMaps: [kerbalmaps.com](http://www.kerbalmaps.com/)

Would a VTOL-assisted rover fall under category 1 or 2?

What I mean is this: I build a vehicle which has wheels as its main propulsion but is able to do small "hops" with a vertically mounted jet engine.

> 
> Would a VTOL-assisted rover fall under category 1 or 2?
> What I mean is this: I build a vehicle which has wheels as its main propulsion but is able to do small "hops" with a vertically mounted jet engine.

Glad you asked!

This will definetly fall under category 2(i like it in style).

By the way, you must show me your work as a video or as an album from imgur.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-22T18:26:43Z" title="05/22/2015 06:26  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 22, 2015</time> by Candlelight**

Aren't these contradictory?

4. **No rockets** and VAB.But, R.A.P.I.E.R's, **SSTO**'s and VTOL's are acceptable

> 
> Aren't these contradictory?
> 4. **No rockets** and VAB.But, R.A.P.I.E.R's, **SSTO**'s and VTOL's are acceptable

Well, read it again.It can be only done by **plane** or manned terrestrial vehicle.**SSTO's** run on **RAPIER's**.And if you read the rule again, it says that **RAPIERS are acceptable(allowed).**

> 
> Well, read it again.It can be only done by **plane** or manned terrestrial vehicle.**SSTO's** run on **RAPIER's**.And if you read the rule again, it says that **RAPIERS are acceptable(allowed).**

By a long way not all SSTOs use RAPIERS but that's OK, if RAPIERS can be used then this is much easier as they are rocket engines and don't have the lag of jets.
So opted to make a badge for you, feel free to use it or I'll just use this one till you get yours up. (See sig below)

Off character, this was the save that I had closer of "Mt. Keverest" from my South Pole expedition. I expect that we will be in the foot of it in 4-6 h of driving in 1x ( less in 2x phys warp ). With some luck I'll be in the peak before the end of this weekend ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Would something akin to Cupcake's VTOL's be acceptable? I've been wanting to try my hand at that type of flying machine, but they don't really qualify as planes, per say.

Can someone offer a more detailed explanation as to where exactly the highest peak is? I've located one that's 6764 meters, and I really don't see any that are higher than that within walking range.

![deWN1cKl.png](http://i.imgur.com/deWN1cKl.png)

I sadly can't explore beyond walking range for... reasons... but in my next attempt, I'd like to aim towards the correct point.

Might make a album later, but for now ...

Anyways, total time was 5 hours and 40 minutes in Kerbal time for the entire trip.

Jeb and Bob are quite happy with the results
